page.title: 10RECREATION
page.content: The land on which{Barclay Park}stands was donated to Hoddesdon by the Barclay Family in 1871. It was given for the people who were out of work to create jobs building the park lake. One of the features of the park that can still be seen today is the line of beech trees on the northern boundary called Beech Walk. Part of the original boundary can still be seen in Lord Street. The park is currently a public amenity area in which can be found the local football team "Hoddesdon Town", the cricket club "Hoddesdon Colts" and the local tennis club. A small part of the park is fenced off as a children's recreational area. Hoddesdon also has a squash club.
